item.title: Kernel Regression
item.description: Kernel smoothing is a meomry-based method to add a flexibility in estimating the regression function by fitting a different but simple model seperately at each query point $x_0$ with only those observations close to the target point $x_0$. This localization is achieved via kernel $K_\lambda(\mathbf{X}_0, \mathbf{X})$, which assigns a weight to $\mathbf{X}$ based on its distance from $\mathbf{X}_0$. Kernel Functions $K_\lambda(\mathbf{X}_0, \mathbf{X})=D\left(\dfrac{d(\mathbf{X}_0, \mathbf{X})}{h_\lambda(\mathbf{X}_0)}\right)$ Kernel function can be divided by three parts: distance function, width function, and weighting function.
